de.must.appletserver
Class RemoteElement

java.lang.Object
  de.must.appletserver.RemoteElement
All Implemented Interfaces:
AppletTalker, Remotable, RemoteContent
Direct Known Subclasses:
DataList, ImagePresenter, Label, MustCheckBox, MustComboBox, MustInputField, TextPresenter, TwoListTransformer, UniversalTable
public abstract class RemoteElement
extends java.lang.Object
implements RemoteContent

A pseudo-GUI element able to become visible remotely (by an applet).

setEditable

public void setEditable(boolean editable)
Sets the flag that determines whether or not this component is editable. This means: value may be changed by user. It does not mean, that user may type in characters. To allow this, use setEditableForUserTyping. If the flag is set to true, this component becomes user editable. If the flag is set to false, the cannot change the text of this text component.

Parameters:
editable - a flag indicating whether this component should be user editable
See Also:
#setEditableForUserTyping

selectAll

public void selectAll()
Description copied from interface: RemoteContent
Selects all input of the component, if it is supported - e.g. in JTextField. Allows easy new input, because the previous value is reseted when the first key stroke occurs.

Specified by:
selectAll in interface RemoteContent

setVisible

public void setVisible(boolean visible)
Makes the component visible or invisible.

Parameters:
visible - true to make the component visible; false to make it invisible
